doc.after: Some years later a dispute developed between Bishop and certain high ranking members of the NJM Though Bishop cooperated with Cuba and the USSR on various trade and foreign policy issues he sought to maintain a non aligned status Bishop had been taking his time making Grenada wholly socialist encouraging private sector development in an attempt to make the island a popular tourist destination Hardline Marxist party members including Communist Deputy Prime Minister Bernard Coard deemed Bishop insufficiently revolutionary and demanded that he either step down or enter into a power sharing arrangement
